website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind paying a premium, Amazon's Kindle Oasis is the waterproof ebook reader you've been waiting for.

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and SUPER light weight
customer_reviews.text: I was an early Kindle user and loved my keyboard kindles...and was dreading going to an on-screen touch keyboard. My worries were unfounded. I love the design: new touch screen key pad is effortless, I'm impressed by how super fast the new kindle refreshes and updates from my earlier models. I really like the asymmetrical shape which works ambidextrously. All in all I am more than impressed. The battery life - as mentioned by other reviewers is not an issue for me - I think I can read 18 -24 hours solidly before battery needs a top up. Pretty good. I am very happy and not missing my old kindles one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Annie-kindlefan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, my best flying companion.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome e-reader. I previously owned a Voyage which was troublesome, this thing is so much better. Very quick boot, very responsive and excellent battery life. I use it while flying long haul and really enjoy using it. The bigger screen is great as I use a very large font to avoid eye strain and the extra screen area really helps get words on the screen. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Just sublime
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely delighted with the Oasis. I switched from a paperwhite and so pleased I did. The Oasis is a huge step up in build and functionality. Well constructed, more like reading a book than e reader. The auto brightness function works really well. Audible addition is a new feature for me and paired easily with bluetooth speakers. I read other reviews regarding battery life and to be honest I don't notice much of a difference from my previous paperwhite battery life. Thoroughly recommend this. Its the Bentley of e readers.
customer_reviews.author: Dr John A Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is appalling
customer_reviews.text: If you want to treat this as a mobile phone and charge every couple of days, this is for you. If you want something close to several weeks battery life, stick to one of the other models. I use this with the wifi & bluetooth off at all time, latest firmware, can't get more than a week of light reading out of it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Assun

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Developed a fault after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Think very carefully before buying the expensive model! Top of the line but developed a lighting fault (see attached) after 18 months. Amazon customer service shockingly will not offer any type of support or repair to customers in the UK - only those in the USA! Only now good for the bin - so a very expensive mistake - I feel foolish
customer_reviews.author: Jay Rawlings

customer_reviews.title: My new Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to change my old trusty Paperwhite so took a while to decide on Oasis as a replacement. I am sadly disappointed by the short battery life and wish I'd heeded other reports on this issue. I am having to recharge far more regularly than ever before. I also expected it to be lighter in weight than my 'old' version, but there is little difference. Plus points? Like the page turning buttons and look forward to using for audio books. Otherwise a costly alternative when maybe I had expected better. Battery life is pretty crucial and paying more for less is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kay - Sussex

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very good reproduction, amazingly light; however i have had to restart several times to get the Bluetooth to be come workable , absolutely no reason why this is necessary, but it is annoying and time wasting, but I am enjoying it,
customer_reviews.author: RVG

customer_reviews.title: Feels great to hold
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked for a waterproof case for his old kindle keyboard edition and my search came up with this. He LOVES it! Feels great to hold, has a backlight and is safe to use in the bath.
customer_reviews.author: MiniEmma

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible service
customer_reviews.text: The audio function of the kindle malfunctions. I have been online or on the phone for about 4.5 hours with amazon trying to sort out the problem - replace the device. The issue is still not sorted. One would think that after so many hours of rebooting, restarting, updating books, downloading books and the like , Amazon would be able to get its act together and authorise a replacement. But no more suffering and being put on hold is required. Heart surgery takes less than this. Since my review after another two hours of being shunted around and being made to wait, still no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: LiliB

customer_reviews.title: NOT IMPRESSED.
customer_reviews.text: Four weeks after the year long warranty ran out, Amazon has refused to replace Kindle when a fault occurred. Seemingly if it dies after a year you have no option but to buy a new one. Considering my first ever Kindle from years ago is still in working order. Also it was mentioned that I may have been responsible in some way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery Not Long
customer_reviews.text: "Battery that lasts weeks not hours". Firstly that is a bit fake since they base it on 0.5 hours/day so weeks can mean as little as 7 hours. And with airplane mode on and in a normal indoor room it seems to last 5-7 hours before the battery dies. Waterproof is theoretically nice but single raindrops can cause the page to turn and a couple of raindrops seemed to stop the page turn buttons from working properly. But I do like the big screen and shape. Overall a nice experience. Other odd issue is that the thicker area seems highly magnetic - which gives me cause for concern. I try to avoid holding that thick magnetic side of the kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Great e-reader even at the price
customer_reviews.text: My old kindle was starting to struggle after maybe 8 years of hard use. I jumped on Amazon on Prime day and took advantage of the discounts being offered on the Oasis and I am happy I did. The Oasis is a massive upgrade from my old device. Most impressive has been the backlight, which is unobtrusive and comes on so gently that you barely notice it. The zoom options work very well, and while the interface took me a little while to get used to compared to my old kindle (the one with the keyboard below the screen) it works exceptionally well. If you are in the market for an e-reader then this device is great, despite the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Timmmaay

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to hold even though I have large hands. Unbalanced. Need 2 hands to change from forward to back switch or touch screen in portrait view. Easier to hold in landscape view. Switches don’t always work. Battery life poor. Also shuts down without warning. Not as good as my original basic kindle. Very disappointing. List of books in library is useful much better than picture of front cover.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Connect Bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really annoying! firstly was very excited about getting this product, however it really was extremely disappointing! Considering the technology available and the price of this product! it really is frustrating that the kindle oasis can not connect to headphones! Tried Bowers and Wilkins PX headphones no joy! then tried Bose wireless still nothing. Tried the Amazon helpline no joy there either! If you want out of the box seamless connectivity this is not the product for you! Shall be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: mb2019

customer_reviews.title: Oasis proves Amazon kindle still the king of books
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, have wanted a kindle since their original inception... However I love to read in the bath and by the pool side.. Meaning a good old fashioned book was the only way, now the oasis is waterproof to IPX8 I can bring my reading up to date, 10 minutes off charge and I can't put it down, great feel and weight the gold looks classy in the premium brown leather case, the 9 watt charger has it ready to go in not time at all (not included) I own the paperwhite 3 and the difference is profound, better even lighting and flat screen makes a huge difference, love it
customer_reviews.author: BadgerB

customer_reviews.title: Great performer.  Diffilcult to put down if you're reading a good book
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight with a great backlight, not too bright to cause glare and tire the eyes, but sufficient to allow you to read in a darkened room. Perfect if your partner wants to sleep and you want to read, no arguing over light on or light off! Much better than my previous Sony eReader. Super easy to download a book from Amazon and start reading. The only downside I've found is that getting back to the library once you've got to the end of book isn't intuitive. The way I've found is to click on the suggestions from the next book, then click on the "home" icon. Not as simpole as my previous eReader.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Newman

customer_reviews.title: new oasis just as bad as earlier model.
customer_reviews.text: support not forthcoming device supposedly top of the range does not do the job, what does it take to get a solution?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad battery time. Not comfortable to hold. Much preferred the previous edition. Also too bulky in width
customer_reviews.author: Daniele Bull

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced big time. It says battery life is 7 days when the reality is only 6 hours very very disappointed absolutely not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Failure
customer_reviews.text: I received this new Oasis this morning. It appeared to be in a Transport state with a picture on the screen. Subsequently it opened in a Diagnostic state and I found it impossible to get out of this despite following the advice available on the web including pressing the on off key for fourteen seconds. There were no instructions with the Oasis other than a rudimentary illustration. Apparently there are instructions in the software but I couldn't reach these since the Oasis was stuck in Diagnostic. I have returned the Oasis for a refund. I have ordered another and hope this first one was a one off !
customer_reviews.author: Pof Roger Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, impractical. Very bad ergonomic design (Medium-Large hands), poor battery.
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Looks great - Screen size is appreciated - Very thin other than the bump Cons - Very uncomfortable to hold, not just a bit, VERY slippy and pointy corners an hour or two = hands fatigued - Battery is appauling, its possible mine is a dud though as it was dying in approx 1 day with flight mode on and only a hour or two reading so doesn't seem right - Got extremely hot in sun while reading (UK not exactly tropical climate). Overall its just not fit for purpose, really wish it was and wanted to like it as it looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine York

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION - Painful to hold
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this new kindle - except for the ultra sharp edges. The kindle is super light, and designed for holding in one hand. Well, it is light, but it feels as if it is going to slice through your hand if you use it like this. I would return it if I could
customer_reviews.author: Fun chappie

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: The oasis was brought because I was fed up with trying to change pages using the 'swipe' method. Either it didn't work the first time, or I swiped two pages! The new oasis somehow feels much better to hold, probably because it is lighter. The buttons to change the pages are a big improvement. The type face seems easier to read. Altogether, although expensive, I am delighted with this new Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs SMP

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic e-reader with astonishing battery
customer_reviews.text: Great bit of kit! Battery seems to last forever, weeks at a time Screen is crystal clear even in direct sunlight Lots of options to change font type, size and spacing Holds an astonishing amount of books Weights sod all so can carry around without a second thought One end is thicker so fits really well in your hand and feels natural to hold Build wise it's been dragged around many city's and camping trips and not a scratch on it, really premium Has tripled the amount I read!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this kindle. It is perfectly balanced in the hand and the larger screen makes for a surprisingly significant improvement in reading experience.
customer_reviews.author: ADI

customer_reviews.title: With the new discount, worth buying it
customer_reviews.text: Briefly, the change from Paprerback to Oasis in terms of lecture enjoyment is significant. Another type of experience due obviously to the bigger screen. Otherfise the options are the same so no major changes which is good actually because the interface is familiar for usage. The only minus is surprisingly the battery life despite the indication that wuold last longer. Personally I haven't observe that. However a full charge take around 30 minutes so much faster than previous model. Overall a great device.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I tend to prefer books rather than ebooks until I used Kindle Oasis. Having a good limited Arabic books on Amazon has encouraged me to purchase it. I really like the following: 1. Small compact design fits in almost all handbags 2. Single handed usage. I can hold it comfortably for a while due to its light weight 3. Ability to change font size, take notes and share them 4. Linking to my Goodreads account 5. Battery lasts for days with reading (don't use audiobooks) Suggested improvements: 1. Increase the speed of flipping pages and browsing Amazon or Goodreads. 2. Charging cable to be type c
customer_reviews.author: Nada F. Al Fahad

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a faulty Oasis that would not play any audible books at all. I am very disappointed to find that all content has to be delivered from 'manage content and devices' it will not sync with the cloud. Audible will not play most audio books, when I try to listen to a book that is clearly on my Kindle, a message stating that the book cannot be found on the device pops up. I purchased an audible book 4 days ago and it has still not appeared on my device!!!! After hours of telephone conversations and being passed between Kindle and Audible support I will be returning the kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I really bought this as it was waterproof and in that regard it is excellent. I did not really have any expectations that it would be significantly better than my previous kindle in other regards. It does have a slightly bigger screen and it feels a bit more responsive when you use it but these are marginal improvements. Where I have been really dissapointed is the battery life. My old kindle would comfortably last 6 weeks even when used a fair bit. I have taken the oasis on holiday and am having to charge it every second day. Thanis a real step backwards for me.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I love my kindle voyage which was an improvement on the paperwhite, and thought I'd see what the Oasis was like. I shouldn't have bothered. The lack of symmetry is definitely unappealing, as is the fact that the turn buttons make a noise. Amazon would do better to release a larger screen e-reader but on the same lines as the voyage.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Bell

customer_reviews.title: Much more uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the Oasis after my excellent Paperwhite gave up the ghost after several years. Unfortunately, it's not going well so far. The lop-sided feel - one side is thicker and heavier than the other - means you can't swap hands easily. In addition, the battery is running down so fast - not that much different to my tablet - that I think there must be a fault with it. I haven't used the audio yet but on current assessments, this is a very disappointing purchase and upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Findings

customer_reviews.title: Great size and no glare whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Great to have a kindle with no glare. The fire tablet is good but useless for reading because of this, so I was pleased the Oasis was more like my original kindle. Great to take on holiday with it being waterproof and the size and weight of it is perfect. Issues are mainly with the price as I think it is very expensive (bought it on Prime Day and I still thought it was very steep) and it would have been great to have had the book covers etc in colour.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A remarkable product
customer_reviews.text: An excellent birthdday present. I've previously had the original kindle and kindle paperwhite and worn out both with good use over a period of some years. I hate change, yet I find that I love the size, shape and comfort of the kindle oasis. The fact that the screen can be operated with either left or right hand is a major plus. The page turning keys along with the standard swipe make this kindle remarkably easy to use.product.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine Ann Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Appalling battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this way back in December 2017 simply because it was the only model then that supported audible books. The size is good, the screen very clear but the battery life from day one has been dreadful. Now, almost 3 years on, it drains away by about half in two days. Luckily I have an original paper white which I take away on holiday with me and, despite being older than this Oasis, lasts almost all the time I am away. Not worth the extra money partularly as the other models now support audible.
customer_reviews.author: Sjj1303

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade to a paperwhite..... I love the increased screen area and the scroll buttons BUT I just can't give it a good review because of the battery life. My paperwhite lasts 10-14 days before needing a charge. The Oasis does not last two days of my normal use (I read a lot!).
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Dawes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life; apart from that it's not bad
customer_reviews.text: Awful battery life. If you forget to turn on Areoplane Mode you'll be getting low batteries warnings before you finish your book if it's about 400 pages or longer so get yourself a big powerbank. I'd have been much happier with a thicker device that had a bigger battery, which would probably have helped with the other issue I have had. It bending. Because of its thinness if you do put it in a clothes pocket and bend or move in a way that stretchs the pocket the screen is liable to banana.
customer_reviews.author: T Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.text: My third Kindle and a lovely upgrade. I enjoy the page turn buttons (rather than screen pressing my Paperwhite). Flipping the device over to change hands works well for me. Very light and compact. I have purchased a cover and it's still a delight to hold.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Greenway

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Text to Speech
customer_reviews.text: Because my eyesight is deteriorating I bought this model in the hope that it would include the text to speech function of the original kindle with different voices . Sadly it did not and voiceview is temperamental and quite difficult to use. Providing good text to speech functionality would make the oasis perfect although I suspect this would make audible less desirable and, less profitable . Very good, clear display, good Bluetooth connectivity but it does eat battery life. Never having had good eyesight the kindles helped me to enjoy reading books again, and over the years the improvements in the kindles kept up with the worsening of my eyesight!
customer_reviews.author: Panos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kindle for rainy london
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable. You can't beat a kindle to read under the sun. Water resistant in London rain ☔ is extremely useful.
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly light to use
customer_reviews.text: The unit is incredibly light to hold with a screen that is clear and easy to read. It also has a bluetooth facility for headphones (music or audio books) and charges super fast to give a never ending usage. Set up was virtually automatic in that it knew who I was, what I had in my library, transferred it instantly and there it was. Within 5 minutes up and ready to go. Very impressed. One small criticism, a protective sleeve wouldn't go amiss. After spending a considerable amount of money I had to buy a sleeve as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchy

customer_reviews.title: Update. Overall a real waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is definitely not as advertised -- lucky to get more than 12 hours of actual reading. I have also experienced the apparently random page turning reported by others. I have been able to link audible books to my echo, which is why I bought the oasis but in practice I haven't used this facility enough to make it worthwhile. One of the worst features is the slippery plastic of the reader body, making it very difficult to hold (just about impossible with one hand and very easy to let it slip).Every time I try to use it I find myself going back to my paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence leger

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this device is expensive compared to other Kindles, but if you read frequently as I do it’s worth every penny and provides a great reading experience. I haven’t found the battery life an issue. It does last longer if you don’t leave it constantly connected to the internet and it charges remarkably quickly with the latest Power-Fast USB charger (bought separately). I purchased the ‘new’ Amazon Water-Safe Fabric Cover to go with it and I’m also thrilled with that. I’ve had most of the different Kindles and this is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful battery
customer_reviews.text: Great while your using it, all works smoothly and I want the WiFi on for other devices and the self adjustable light and I read for about 4 hours per day. BUT with doing this the battery needs to be charged every THIRD day. I’m mainly just reading, so any claims by Amazon of a better battery life to me are ridiculous. I am using a third of the battery perI day. just for reading. I have a smaller Oasis model, and using it the same amount the battery lasted about a week, as did the other two kindles I had. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alby

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original Oasis
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen is over-sensitive - tapping to turn a page often turns more than one page at a time - sometimes three or four. It's not quite as easy to hold, but then the screen is bigger so it's swings and roundabouts. The page-turn buttons give an audible click every time - which is a pain when you're trying to read quietly next to a slumbering partner. The battery life is reduced now that there is no case-battery to supplement the built-in battery. It's still a good Kindle, but not as good as the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dodman

customer_reviews.title: Fab-u-lous
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting ages for one of these and finally I’ve got my hands on one, well it was worth the wait, I have had the basic kindle ereader, then moved onto the Kindle Fire HD, then HDX cellular (which I am still using) also a Paperwhite (which my husband now uses) and I have also had the HD10 and the HD the 8, all of whi h still workand still get used at different times, and are all great pieces of kit but the Kindle Oasis well, what canI say fab-u-lous best ever e-reader Amazon have ever made thank you Amazon, and the price equates the quality of the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best but with one small flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kindle I've owned. Very thin and light and the screen resolution is so good that the letters are indistinguishable from its printed counterpart. The user interface is pretty well laid out and clear to navigate but there is still room for improvement. I've given this 4 stars instead of 5 due to the backlight. Although the backlight is bright and uniformly lit across the screen, it is unfortunately very blue. With various studies showing that blue light disrupts sleep, this device is unsuitable for bedtime reading, although I do it anyway. I hope the subsequent version has a warmer backlight for a 5 star rating!
customer_reviews.author: Gooner

customer_reviews.title: Very good ereader
customer_reviews.text: I like that its waterproof as I managed to drown my paperwhite :) The backlighting is much better and the text is clear , the autorotate is very good and its much better at showing maps and illustrations. The build quality is excellent. The only downside is the battery life is not quite as good. So while its more expensive to me it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Vey poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: In actual reading time, the battery in my Oasis lasted for no longer than 12 hours. It needed re-charging every 3 days. I contacted Amazon several times and followed all of their advice and instructions. Eventually, I gave up and returned the device. My review is based upon the Oasis that I received - other Oasis' may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Red Hot
customer_reviews.text: This is to replace my old keyboard kindle ... OMG I feel very lucky to have it. It’s very light, easy to handle, the light adjustment amazes me ... what a wonderful little gadget ... is it worth the high price tag? I’m unsure . However I read so much I can justify it
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Four month review of Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: The battery is good providing it's in aeroplane mode otherwise the battery will be depleted in just a few moments so plug it in for browsing or downloading content. Unfortunately the UK Oasis won't take a charging cover to extend the battery. Something Amazon don't tell you is the front LEDs are cold and they will burn your eyes over long periods of reading because of the blue light radiation. You will need to buy a blue light filter screen cover to over come this or buy a warm halogen light attachment
customer_reviews.author: Public

customer_reviews.title: No battery life if it's on Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Kindle - I needed this as I now listen to audible books. It arrived today and I fully charged it. I paired my headphones and started listening to a new book. I've now had to charge it twice in one day, if it's on Bluetooth the battery only lasts about six hours and there's no mention of this in the description. My ipad charge lasts much longer than that so I'm totally disappointed and can't recommend this product if you need it for audible. The only positive thing is, it doesn't take long to recharge it. A very expensive product not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Doe

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid reader and my previous Kindle stopped working so I needed to replace it, I looked at the Paperlite but it was too small this is a great size small enough to go in a bag but big enough to read easily. The screen is a full size so it feels as if you are reading a book and I think the Kindle is about the size if a normal paperback maybe a bit wider which of course gives you more words on the page, I've used it outdoors in sunlight and there is no problem with glare, I haven't tried the internal light yet but can't see that will be any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It's a replacement for a paperwhite that had died. It's SO much faster! I HATED the new shape at first, but once I got used to it.... well it's fantastic. And unlike the paperwhite, you get a reminder in plenty of time that the battery needs charging. Yes, it's eyewateringly expensive - frankly overpriced if you're listening Amazon!! But I love it and I could not go back to a paperwhite now.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Very clear print but not very good battery life!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall an improvement on my previous Paperwhite which had started to slow down when page turning. Easy to understand controls. Only downside is that I agree with other reviewers who say the battery life is not nearly so good. I am having to recharge about every 4/5 days whereas the previous model only needed charging about every 4 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Rolls Royce good
customer_reviews.text: It's a great eReader but is it worth the premium price? I think so because I'm in the fortunate position where that £100 premium isn't a financial stretch. The resolution is the same as its siblings, the small extra width and choice of button or swipe to change page is nice. The other two main differences aren't compelling for me hence four and not five stars - that's the waterproofing and ability to switch to audio both could be a game changer for some If you can afford the extra then go for it, if not you wont be disappointed with the excellent paper white version
customer_reviews.author: Phil Smith

customer_reviews.title: 😊
customer_reviews.text: I’ve changed from the original kindle which I’ve use for eleven years and, it still works well. So this was always going to be a big difference. Hope it lasts just as long. With the Oasis 2 I don’t use the touchscreen other than to access other menus. Much prefer to change pages using the button. However the touchscreen works well. The main reason I changed was to have the advantage of backlighting which I can turn off when not needed. The screen size is good and obviously a big improvement from the original kindle. I’ve not found anything I don’t like and enjoy using it so if like me you are bit of a dinosaur it time to change..
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: great ereader
customer_reviews.text: i have bought kindles before for family but this is the first one i have bought for myself, i would have stuck with my kobo but they are now unsupported, the thing i noticed was how responsive the screen is and its mega fast compared to my kobo touch and i like the size which is comfortable to hold, the colour is great to, things i don't like is the fact there is not headphone jack socket you have to use Bluetooth headphones, its metal and feels cold without a case on it, found it can sometimes be slow to sync.
customer_reviews.author: Ta Bland

customer_reviews.title: “Battery lasts weeks on a single charge” - if only!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third kindle - I started with the Paperwhite, then got the original Oasis, then this one. It’s great, but the battery life is rubbish. I’m having to charge it every couple of days, whereas the original Oasis (with the charging cover) would need charging about once a fortnight. My usage is the same - a couple of hours reading a day, light not very bright - but charging patterns aren’t. I’ve replaced it under warranty as Customer Support said it sounded like mine was faulty, but the replacement is even worse! Im actually debating switching back to my old Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: J Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Fab kindle!
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a kindle voyage and I do read a lot, I decided to treat myself to one with a larger screen. It does make a difference in my opinion. The battery life did seem to drain rather quick when I first got it but seems to have settled down now. I think this is due to indexing and sorting books. I do find that the oasis is lightweight and lovely to hold. I do like that there are buttons for page turns as well. Overall I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: kaz29

customer_reviews.title: Great reader but disappointing battery life
customer_reviews.text: I love this reader. I went from the old kindle to this version, I could not bring myself to buy one without page turning buttons. It is however very expansive for a slightly bigger screen and 2 buttons. The battery is much much weaker than the old versions. My old kindle could last a month in its prime, this one barely holds a week or 2. It is isn’t the end of the world, but for the price, I think they could do better.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: To start with the positives. I love the screen size and the buttons to turn pages. It’s waterproof which as I often read in the bath is a bonus. Now for the negatives. Amazon say the battery lasts weeks. No it doesn’t. I actually returned the first one I received as the battery was lasting less than two days. The replacement I received is lasting about a week. I haven’t had it long. I think maybe I should have stuck with the paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: Norah

customer_reviews.title: If you have migraines, this is the answer.
customer_reviews.text: Chronic migraine sufferer here, looking for an alternative to printing pdfs of research papers because I can't stare at the screen all day. This kindle was exactly the solution I was looking for. The smart ink really doesn't strain your eyes or emit electronic lights that causes headache and migraines. It's waterproof as well, so you can take it anywhere with you! Not to mention how you're effectively carrying a library of books with you that you can pick and choose what to read anywhere and everywhere! Oh and did I mention the instant ebook download? No longer have to wait for books to arrive! A must have in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: More of the same
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mum who's eyesight is failing as, apparently, it's bigger. Well, it is bigger but not that you'd notice. And what's the point of being bigger if you can't have bigger fonts for people with bad eyesight? Where are the accesibilty options Amazon? Why limit the font size? Why can't we have one word per page if we want to? Summary, buy this if you like wasting money, otherwise just buy the cheapest one, you won't notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Battery life closer to one week than the weeks as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product apart from the battery life. The battery life is advertised as lasting 'week's, but I have to charge mine every week. I have worked out that I use it around 15-16 hours per week and that takes it down from 100% to 10-15%. I always charge it when it reaches around this figure so that it doesn't run out. Apart from that it is great, but remember, the battery life is closer to one week rather than weeks as marketed.
customer_reviews.author: iannewsman

customer_reviews.title: A great reading experience
customer_reviews.text: The design and bigger screen make this one of the best e-readers out there. Although the price tag is a bit high, the reading experience with this reader, with its additional features, make it worth it for the person who uses such devices a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Euclid

customer_reviews.title: So easy to transport.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! I bought one of the first generation Kindles and cannot believe how far they have come on! It’s light, the dictionary plus Wikipedia is invaluable and I take it in my handbag everywhere. I was a dyed in the wool “book” reader but have been totally won over. My partner is now buying one!
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle replaces my first gen Paperwhite. I absolutely love it! The auto brightness can be a bit hit and miss, and the battery is worse than my last Kindle, but if I spend a lot of time reading then it’s not a big deal to just plug it in when I’m done reading. So far the battery lasts about a few weeks with about 1-2 hours reading a day and airplane mode on. I would definitely recommend this Kindle!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dryden-Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Whats to prove?
customer_reviews.text: arrived as promised and well packaged. Sad to say Wife not too impressed at mom as this was to replace her old original Kindle with type etc, she says it is too touch sensitive to read in bed as it turns more than one page at time most of the time. She's using a fire at mom which performs well enough etc, but she will try using the "Oasis" again later I'm sure - I'm going to give 5 stars because I think it is better than she thinks!!
customer_reviews.author: big T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but not for older people with limited use of hands
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my mother, who is 96. She liked the original Kindle readers (no touchscreen and used simple buttons for control). Unfortunately this newer Kindle is not suitable, as she has limited feeling in her hands and the touchscreen is so sensitive that it keeps doing things she doesn't want. If only a non-touchscreen version with buttons was still available....
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Convert +1
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. It was a stretch for me to buy it but... man. Excellent. I would read an average of 4 hours a day, everyday. Only using the back-light at night, on night mode (love that btw), would last me 5 days avg. It charges quick and the bags under my eyes have nearly vanished from not reading off tablets or my laptop. I bought the leather case for it too, mostly out of fear of dropping it. but it too, is worth it. Haven't been happier with a purchase like this in a while. Worth it if you read more than most.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement from the previous Oasis. I was able to read the whole book on the one battery charge.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third kindle and the best so far. I have the gold and found it a bit slippery and lop sided to hold at first. Once I bought a cover it was perfect. It is far more sensitive than previous kindles and you have to be gentle switching off as you can so easily change the page.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.Murray

customer_reviews.title: much better than the first version of the Oasis
customer_reviews.text: much better than the first version of the Oasis. I enjoy the larger screen, and battery charging is much faster
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David Matchett

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good!
customer_reviews.text: I orginally got the oasis when it was first released but there was a bug in the software not showing all books in my library, amazon had no clear date when it would be fixed so I sent it back for a refund. Fast forward to a year later I purchased it again hoping the bug would finally be fixed, and it was! What I like about the oasis is the premium feel, page turn buttons, audible, additional storage. If you want a premium e-reader this is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve_Bham

customer_reviews.title: The best Kindle ever.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant design. Much improved backlight. Bigger screen is genius. The only let down is that the battery life is not as good as expected. It won't last for weeks if you use it every day. Maybe one week.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ward

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Since my kindle Voyage died I’ve been waiting for the right deal to get a replacement. Prime day was the time. I love it. Easy to hold. The page turner buttons are in the right place. The adaptive lighting is a bit slow but it works. Bought for use when travelling and so far the battery lasts well.
customer_reviews.author: Erica F

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable reading
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, with very good screen definition and screen size. I find the two page turning buttons very useful as I have difficulty using my hands dexterously. It is a very good upgrade to my old Kindle which I have had for nearly 8 years.
customer_reviews.author: tim wade

customer_reviews.title: Good update
customer_reviews.text: I used my kindle paperwrite for three years and it was damaged because I accidentally drop it in a pond. I decided to buy this new one and it is definitely beyond my expectation. It is a bit expensive. But with all these new functions, bigger screen, water-proof and physical button, I think it sill worth the price. I brought a 8G one. If it is less expensive, I would definitely go for a 32G one.
customer_reviews.author: QWEI

customer_reviews.title: Size good but battery life poor
customer_reviews.text: Would get more stars if the battery life was better - I am only getting 12 hrs or so reading even with brightness on off, Extra size is lovely Take care on the case you get - I find all the kindles are easier to hold in a case as there is better grip Not always as fast as the paperlight
customer_reviews.author: diolch

customer_reviews.title: Although I like some of the features I have only given 3 stars as in my opinion it is overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I found it light to hold so easy and comfortable to read being able to adjust the text was good,also much easier to carry around. I was able to rearrange the books I had downloaded which was convenient. However for me the downside was that the battery didn’t last for as long as advertised. After having a Kindle fire I missed the colour and also there was so much more you could do, like getting onto the internet receiving my email etc. I think it was overpriced that’s why I have only given 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia C

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life spoils otherwise improved device
customer_reviews.text: The screen flipping for left & right handed use is a big improvement compared to previous versions but the poor battery life spoils the device, it needs charging far more often than my old Kindle Voyage

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the Kindle Voyage
customer_reviews.text: I really love my Kindle Voyage, my Kindle Oasis, not so much... I find the form factor awkward and uncomfortable to hold. The metal case is cold and slippery. And the battery life is noticeably worse. My lesson learnt, don’t chase upgrades if your current device meets requirements/expectations! And... why can’t Amazon design a decent (book like) case!
customer_reviews.author: Domus

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Having previously had kindles from day one (I even had to wait for production of original model), I can only say this one has improved. It is lightweight, easier to hold and the screen changes as you turn it. This means it can be held in the right or the left hand. I was bought this as a birthday present and am extremely pleased to have it.I would be more than happy to recommend this item to others if they are looking for an e-reader.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I love this Kindle. Battery life is above what I expected, reading clarity is exceptional in all light conditions. Great size, very light in the hand. Takes a full charge very quickly. Would be nice if a USB port was added to store additional books instead of using up internal storage. I understand that it can be connected to a computer to do this task but having a USB socket for data transfer would be much quicker and more portable.
customer_reviews.author: barry randall

customer_reviews.title: It is great to hold i like where you can still press the screen.
customer_reviews.text: It stated that the battery on the new oasis lasts longer than the previous kindles but i didnt find that, that was a dissapointment as i read a great deal. After about sixteen hours the battery needed charging. After having my oasis for Two months i charged my battery till it was fully charged went to use it later and the battery is down to thirty eight percent. Dont know if it is a faulty battety i shall be ringing them tommorrow.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Best yet
customer_reviews.text: I've had many Kindles since their beginning. This is the best. The aluminium frame feels more substantive, oddly book-like, while still light and comfortable to hold. The bigger screen is welcome. I also prefer the return to real buttons for forward and back rather than simply touch-sensitivity. The price is the only reservation, and because of it, I waited for awhile before buying. Now I'm very glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Best e-Reader there is
customer_reviews.text: I was put off buying the original Oasis as it didn't seem to offer any significant improvement over my Voyage (same screen size and resolution) plus it was a lot more expensive. Although still expensive the larger screen on the new Oasis is absolutely fantastic. It is light in the hand and its added IPX8 features really make it a go anywhere e-Reader. If your budget can stretch as far as the Oasis then it is definitely the one to get., if not then the Paperwhite is an excellent cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: KEVSKI73

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a definite improvement on the older kindle model that I had but I am disappointed with the interface. The Kindle app for the iPad is far superior in terms of usability but I wanted to avoid the iPad glare at bedtime. The interface is not intuitive. I struggle to find the most basic of functions such as 'go to page' and there doesn't appear to be a facility for instigating 'sync to furthest page read' yourself. Should have gone for the paper white I think - I gather the interface is similar. I am using continuous scrolling in the ipad app and I really like it - Kindle Oasis feels miles behind the times.
customer_reviews.author: Mel at Mountmill

customer_reviews.title: awesome piece of kit, cannot be faulted
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault this piece of kit, feels like an ipad, although the metal back gets a tad sweaty with the moisture from your hands when reading. Much prefer the metal back to the rubberised back of the other types. The battery lasts 4-5 days, based on a couple of hours use a day. The display is excellent - 300pi, the same as professional print. Have been reading a couple of illustrated books, pictures and photos, the KO displays them with clarity and ease. A great reading experience. Worth every penny, oh and it bluetooths seamlessly to a speaker.
customer_reviews.author: lee wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Flawless.. Almost
customer_reviews.text: This is /was a great item, I've since upgraded to the 32gb model. It's very light and so easy to use once you get to grips with how the have set it out. If you listen to books and read too, this is brilliant. My only critiscm which you can do on the fires is listen and read the text at the same time. Which for me is great as it allows you also to quicken up your reading speed. But it's so good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Jacob Fraser

customer_reviews.title: NAFF
customer_reviews.text: Don't like this at all! Not a patch on my old kindle. I find it very annoying and it is not that simple to use. I do not think it is that great a product - goddam battery runs out every day!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to hold and turn the pages - delight to read
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with my Kindle Oasis. I have been reading on a Kindle for quite a few years now and had several generations but this is definitely the best of all (so it should be at this price!) I was using a Kindle Voyage before and the page turning on the Oasis is so much easier. It is also much easier to hold and read in one hand when travelling on a crammed tube! I think the battery life might be shorter based on the Oasis showing the % remaining (which previous ones don't) BUT it could be I have been using it more!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs W

customer_reviews.title: expensive, unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most expensive e-reader out there, and yet it’s flaky. Mine had rebooted without reason at least once a week, and now - at less than 3 months old - it has frozen completely. And Amazon won't take it back unless I actually phone them. You know, in case I made it up ....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Premium look and feel, light and responsive.
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new Oasis. It's lightness in the hand, the extra width on the holding side and the way it flips sides easily, the page turn buttons. I find it responsive when turning pages or moving through my library. I appreciate that I can take it in the bath without an extra waterproof case and not have to worry about dropping it. Yes, it's expensive but it feels and looks premium and I'm happy to have made the extra outlay.
customer_reviews.author: Andy JE

customer_reviews.title: Awful battery life - what a shame
customer_reviews.text: Having had several kindles -indeed this is No 6 in the family I am extremely unhappy with the battery on this new oasis. I charged it to 100% last night and 12 hours later it's 80% with no use at all. I intend to return it. It's a shame as my fire 10 and paperlight are both great. My husband has the original oasis and it's brilliant. May wait for the next generation to come out.
customer_reviews.author: yelsel

customer_reviews.title: A superior daily reading companion
customer_reviews.text: The Oasis has become a daily companion,. It has made reading more accessible and interesting, helping me to appreciate books more and to understand language usage better. I like, too, that Oasis makes reading a social experience. There is room for improvement. The screen is fine, and definitely superior to the screen of a typical tablet, but it could be more responsive. The battery could last even longer; it will last for weeks if one reads lightly each day, but reading (and listening on audible) through a day (as one might do on holiday) can deplete the battery within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thomas Croft

customer_reviews.title: Broken charging
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use these things just refuse to charge. Amazon support is slightly frustrating in that chat support is largely useless - they ask the same old questions of “turn it off then turn it back on again” which is fairly redundant when the thing won’t charge at all! Then told that the only way forward is to call, and you have to speak to agents who have a poor grasp of English and are very hard to understand. Frustrating experience and weak charging port lets this expensive device down - expected more from an apparently “premium” product that is quite shoddily built, and let down by poor Amazon support
customer_reviews.author: "kingblahtastic"

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've had a number of kindles over the years and recently had my Voyage stolen. Devastated. With them no longer selling the voyage I decided to splash out and get the Oasis. Best decision I ever made. I could not be happier with it. The battery life is a bit pants but seen as I charge it every couple of days anyway. Everything else about it is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Rechi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded to this from paperwhite. Love it. Feels good in my hand when reading, much better having buttons on right hand side where holding with kindle being able to be turned round for use with people who are left handed. Auto light is good. Had no issues with battery life, tend to recharge all my gadgets each night anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jinty

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: The wider format closely resembles a 'paper book' and the ability to invert the screen is handy given the protruding side. All the features you would expect for this next generation Kindle are here. I also purchased the 'cloth cover' (in blue) which is much more tactile than my previous 'leather covers'. However, I do experience a 'lag' when opening the cover - I doubt that this lag is anything to do with the cover, but more likely to do with the unit awaking.
customer_reviews.author: Gilles

product_meta.title: Kindle Oasis - Waterproof, 8GB Wi-Fi (Previous Generation – 9th)
feature_bullets: Now available in stylish Gold and Graphite colour options.
Our largest, highest resolution display—7” and 300 ppi, reads like printed paper, without glare, even in bright sunlight.
The first waterproof Kindle (IPX8), so you are free to read in even more places.
Now with Audible you have access to over 200,000 audio titles. Pair with Bluetooth to take the story with you anytime, anywhere.
Thin and light ergonomic design with dedicated page-turn buttons and adaptive front light so you can read even more comfortably for hours.
Keep reading—a single charge lasts weeks, not hours.
Enjoy twice the storage with 8 GB. Or choose 32 GB to hold more magazines, comics, newspapers and audiobooks.
Massive selection, low prices—over 5.5 million books including latest bestsellers, Kindle exclusives and more.
Prime members read for free with unlimited access to a rotating selection of more than a thousand titles.
